The video was confirmed to be a symbolic: protest vote' in areas where the presidential election had been postponed due to security concerns and an Ebola outbreak.
The video was widely shared on social me: such as Facebook and Twitter, with captions implying it was a genuine representation of the election process in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).
The presence of a man wearing a blue jac: Electoral Agent CENI' and another man with a paper sticker on his shirt with the words 'CENI-Butembo' written on it was observed in the video.
AFP journalist Alexis Huguet: who covered the DRC's elections, reported on the mock voting conducted after the cancellation by the electoral body (CENI) and confirmed the use of sacks or old ballot boxes from previous elections in some areas.
